newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - IBM up, Netscape off.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - IBM up, Netscape off.

text.p: Shares in International Business Machines Corp rose 3/4 to 124-1/4 preceding Wednesday's market open after Merrill Lynch named IBM its Focus One stock of the week, traders said.
The early gains extended IBM's two-month, upward run from the mid 90s and pushed the shares closer to their year-high 128-7/8 reached in February.
Merrill said it rates IBM a near- and long-term buy.
Meanwhile, Merrill's downgrade of Netscape Communications Corp to neutral from buy this morning sliced four points off the stock to 42, traders said.
With its addition to the Standard & Poor's 500 Index, Lucent Technologies Inc rose 1/2 to 41-1/8, they said.

When a stock is added to the index, its spurs buying by index mutual funds tied to the S&P 500 and puts the stock on the list of some investors who view the components as potential buys, the trader said.

Allied Waste Industries Inc gained 1/8 to 9-1/4 ahead of the market open following its announcment early this morning that it would buy the solid waste management operations of Laidlaw Inc for $1.5 billion in cash, stock and notes.

CFC International Inc is expected to open lower after it said third-quarter earnings will fall below estimates and year-ago levels. It cited a new product, a delayed delivery schedule, and expenses for market research in the Pacific Rim.
Before the open, the shares were quoted at 14-1/2 bid, 15-1/4 ask, below Tuesday's close of 16.

Also, Citation Corp is expected to fall after it said fiscal year earnings would fall 15 to 20 percent below forecasts. Citation gained 3/16 to 11-7/8 Tuesday, but was quoted at 11-1/8 bid, 11-1/2 ask before the open.
